title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for minimum at x = 3

1 point is earned for justification

f'(x) < 0 for 0 < x < 3 and f'(x) > 0 for x > 3

Therefore, f has a relative minimum at x = 3.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for minimum at x = 3

1 point is earned for justification

f'(x) < 0 for 0 < x < 3 and f'(x) > 0 for x > 3

Therefore, f has a relative minimum at x = 3.

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for justification

f'(x) < 0 for 0 < x < 3 and f'(x) > 0 for x > 3

Therefore, f has a relative minimum at x = 3.

The student earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for minimum at x = 3

1 point is earned for justification

f'(x) < 0 for 0 < x < 3 and f'(x) > 0 for x > 3

Therefore, f has a relative minimum at x = 3.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points is earned for f''(x)

1 point is earned for the answer with reason

f ″ (x)= e x +(x−3) e x =(x−2) e x f ″ (x)>0 for x>2 f ′ (x)<0 for 0<x<3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@650B@

Therefore, the graph of f is both decreasing and concave up on the interval 2 < x < 3.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for using initial condition

2 points is earned for using integration by parts

1 point is earned for answer

f(3)=f(1)+ ∫ 1 3 f ′ (x)  dx=7+ ∫ 1 3 (x−3) e x  dx​                       u=x−3    dv= e x dx​                      du=dx        v= e x ​​ f(3)=7+ (x−3) e x | 1 3 − ∫ 1 3 e x  dx​        =7+ ((x−3) e x − e x ) | 1 3        =7+3e− e 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@E0FC@
